page.title: 02HOUSING-BROCKWORTH AREA
page.content: Buildings in our area (bounded by the settlements of Brockworth,Witcombe and Cranham) include {post-war private semis} and {detached};and {post-war council.} Suburban gardens are full of colour, scent, shrubs, trees and vegetables. Old {Cotswold stone} buildings appear in the more rural parts as does mellowed {red brick.} Some of the {bigger buildings} include a {public house} and Prinknash {Abbey} (a mixture of the ancient and the modern) as well as over ten {farms.} Eight disused {quarries} show the source of much of the local building material. Works land of the Glos.{Trading Estate} runs into our survey-area which is also divided by the A417 and the A46. The hills look down to the Severn and have evidence of a variety of {pre-historic} and {Roman} settlements.
